posts.post_content: Wanted to buy this at the Heritage auction a few weeks ago, but $2676 seemed high with that crease. Presents very well!

[quote name="groundskeeper" post=1879040]Wanted to buy this at the Heritage auction a few weeks ago, but $2676 seemed high with that crease. Presents very well![/QUOTE]

I am no expert on this but it is at least poor form to interject your opinions on price into someone’s BST thread. And pretty sure it’s against the forum rules. Not cool. Seeing more and more of this all the time. 

Great card. Good luck with the sale.

It is poor form and most collectors on this board have knowledge. 

Thank you Mr. Angelo for your post. I am glad you were able to pick one up at that price and in the future. You are also very intelligent for seeing that crease because without your input I nor anyone else would have seen it.

Either way hopefully you get removed from this board as a bit advanced for you and seems as if you already have a warning given your name disclosed.  




Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Thanks Pete


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

[quote name="ezez420" post=1879061]It is poor form and most collectors on this board have knowledge. 

Thank you Mr. Angelo for your post. I am glad you were able to pick one up at that price and in the future. You are also very intelligent for seeing that crease because without your input I nor anyone else would have seen it.

Either way hopefully you get removed from this board as a bit advanced for you and seems as if you already have a warning given your name disclosed.  




Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk[/QUOTE]

Mr. Deserio, as a good-faith collector, I think it's bad form to try to flip a card for a 60% markup less than a month after an auction. Obviously I may be alone in that thinking on this board, but that's how it goes in life sometimes. I bet you will sell it, though-- it is a rare card! GLWS!

I am guessing you may be alone and probably shouldn’t be on this board. It is also quite clear your post is retaliatory in nature and terrible form. 

I would be happy to understand the rules of collecting or selling especially that I am so inexperienced.  I am sorry if I don’t understand capital markets as well. 

But I will say that we are likely operating in different leagues so you may want to keep your comments to yourself. 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Fair enough.
I'll probably end up buying the damn thing!
This forum is for everyone dont tell someone they cant call you out if you are not being legit man

[quote name="sayitaintso" post=1879356]This forum is for everyone dont tell someone they cant call you out if you are not being legit man[/QUOTE]

Not sure what this comment even means.

[quote name="sayitaintso" post=1879356]This forum is for everyone dont tell someone they cant call you out if you are not being legit man[/QUOTE]

Actually, no he can't do what he did. There isn't anything illegitimate that I can see. Members can ask any price they want to for something. It is not anyone else's business what price is asked with respect to any profit or cost or anything else. If you don't like someone's price then don't buy it. But don't comment about it unless it is a PM and then it shouldn't be in a harassing fashion. Please consider this your final warning. Thanks man.

[quote name="groundskeeper" post=1879238]Mr. Deserio, as a good-faith collector, I think it's bad form to try to flip a card for a 60% markup less than a month after an auction. Obviously I may be alone in that thinking on this board, but that's how it goes in life sometimes. I bet you will sell it, though-- it is a rare card! GLWS![/QUOTE]

Infraction given. Totally unacceptable post.
should be deleted in between...including mine. A true hobbyist know the rules here
